thread.title: Caitlin Clark Elated by Luke Combs’s Congratulatory Message After WNBA Draft
thread.title_full: Caitlin Clark Elated by Luke Combs’s Congratulatory Message After WNBA Draft

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Caitlin Clark Elated by Luke Combs’s Congratulatory Message After WNBA Draft
text:
By Thomas Neumann ,
1 hour ago
Caitlin Clark is a big fan of Luke Combs, and the feeling is mutual.
The former Iowa Hawkeyes standout was selected No. 1 overall in the 2024 WNBA draft on Monday night, to the surprise of nobody in the women’s basketball world. She’s headed to the Indiana Fever, and 36 of the team’s 40 games will be televised nationally this season as a direct result of her popularity.
In the moments following Clark’s draft selection, she was treated to a congratulatory video from the country music star.
“I just wanted to say congratulations on being the No. 1 pick in the WNBA draft. That’s incredible,” Combs said. “I know I can speak for everybody all across the United States and the world, probably, that we’ve enjoyed watching you these last couple years, and we can’t wait to continue to do so. So congratulations. You earned it. Can’t wait to see you out there.”
Clark was clearly elated by the message.
“Luke Combs! That’s my favorite artist of all time,” Clark said. “That’s pretty cool. He’s a big women’s basketball fan, so I appreciate him. That’s amazing. I was not expecting that!”
Clark makes her WNBA preseason debut when the Fever visit the Dallas Wings on May 3. Her regular-season pro debut will be a road game against the Connecticut Sun on May 14 at 7:30 p.m. ET. That game will be broadcast on ESPN2.
